Global.title: Steaks
Global.description: High-quality cuts of meat cooked to preference

Global.title: Barbecue Fish
Global.description: Fish grilled or smoked over an open fire or on a barbecue

Global.title: Ceviche
Global.description: A seafood dish made from fresh raw fish cured in citrus juices

Global.title: Curry
Global.description: A variety of dishes originating in the Indian subcontinent that use a complex combination of spices

Global.title: Carpaccio
Global.description: Dish of thinly sliced raw meat or fish, drizzled with olive oil

Global.title: Hummus
Global.description: A thick, creamy paste made from ground chickpeas and other ingredients

Global.title: Falafel
Global.description: A deep-fried ball or patty made from ground chickpeas, fava beans, or both

Global.title: Crème Brûlée
Global.description: A rich custard base topped with a layer of hardened caramelized sugar

Global.title: Tiramisu
Global.description: A coffee-flavoured Italian dessert

Global.title: Éclair
Global.description: A pastry made with choux dough filled with a cream and topped with a flavored icing

Global.title: Tahini
Global.description: A condiment made from toasted ground hulled sesame

Global.title: Greek Salad
Global.description: A salad made primarily of tomatoes, cucumbers, olives, feta cheese, and a dressing

Global.title: Nicoise Salad
Global.description: A salad originating from Nice, France, typically made of tomatoes, hard-boiled eggs, Niçoise olives, anchovies, and various green beans

Global.title: Brie cheese
Global.description: Brie is a soft cow's-milk cheese named after Brie, the French region from which it originated.

Global.title: Camembert
Global.description: Camembert is a moist, soft, creamy, surface-ripened cow's milk cheese. It was first made in the late 18th century in Camembert, Normandy, in northwest France.

Global.title: Buche cheese
Global.description: Buche de Chevre is an exquisite soft cheese made from goat's milk and produced in the Poitou-Charentes region in the Loire Valley of central France.

Global.title: Burrata
Global.description: Burrata is an Italian cow milk cheese made from mozzarella and cream

Global.title: Amba
Global.description: Amba or anba is a tangy mango pickle condiment of Indo-Iraqi origin.

Global.title: Donar kebab
Global.description: Doner kebab, also spelled as döner kebab, is a dish of Turkish origin made of meat cooked on a vertical rotisserie.

Global.title: Red Wine
Global.description: Red wine is a type of wine made from dark-colored grape varieties.

Russian.title: Pelmeni
Russian.description: Pelmeni are dumplings of Russian cuisine that consist of a filling wrapped in thin, unleavened dough. It is debated whether they originated in Ural or Siberia. Pelmeni have been described as the heart of Russian cuisine

Russian.title: Blini
Russian.description: Traditionally also called a blin is a Russian and more broadly Eastern European pancake traditionally made from buckwheat flour or nowadays wheat and served with smetana, tvorog, butter, caviar and other garnishes.

Russian.title: Berries
Russian.description: Berries are very tasty and useful gifts from nature. They are a delight for even the most fastidious taste, loved by young and old. Berries are fragrant and fresh, useful for your memory and heart.

Russian.title: Caviar
Russian.description: Caviar is a food consisting of salt-cured roe of the family Acipenseridae. Caviar is considered a delicacy and is eaten as a garnish or spread.

Russian.title: Vodka
Russian.description: Vodka is a clear distilled alcoholic beverage. Different varieties originated in Poland, Russia, and Sweden. Vodka is composed mainly of water and ethanol but sometimes with traces of impurities and flavourings.

Russian.title: Birch Sap
Russian.description: Birch sap, birch water or birch juice is the sap directly tapped from birch trees, Betula pubescens, Betula pendula, Betula lenta, Betula papyrifera, and Betula fontinalis.

Russian.title: Pirozhki
Russian.description: Pirozhki are foremost, Russian baked or fried yeast-leavened boat-shaped buns with a variety of fillings. Pirozhki are a popular street food and comfort food in Eastern Europe.

Russian.title: Plombir
Russian.description: Plombir is a type of Soviet ice cream made with vanilla, cream, eggs, and sugar. It was subject to national Soviet standards, which required that it be made with natural ingredients and meet specifications for consistency and fat and sugar content.

Russian.title: Draniki
Russian.description: Draniki are shallow-fried pancakes of grated or ground potato, matzo meal or flour and a binding ingredient such as egg or applesauce, often flavored with grated garlic or onion and seasonings.

Russian.title: Lisichky
Russian.description: Cantharellus cibarius is a species of golden chanterelle mushroom in the genus Cantharellus. It is also known as girolle. It grows in Europe from Scandinavia to the Mediterranean Basin, mainly in deciduous and coniferous forests.

Russian.title: Ukha
Russian.description: Ukha is a clear Russian soup, made from various types of fish such as bream, wels catfish, northern pike, or even ruffe.

Russian.title: Dark Bread
Russian.description: Dark rye bread is a traditional Russian bread made with dark rye flour, molasses, fresh coriander seeds and caraway. It's classically made using rye sourdough starter, but can be made with regular starter or yeast.

Russian.title: Borscht
Russian.description: Borscht is a sour soup, made with meat stock, vegetables and seasonings.

Russian.title: Smetannik
Russian.description: Tort Smetannik means a cake with sour cream.

Russian.title: Shuba
Russian.description: Shuba salad, or “Herring Under a Fur Coat,” is a layered salad of pickled herring fillets, finely chopped onion, beets, carrots

Russian.title: Olivier
Russian.description: Olivier salad is a traditional salad dish in Russian cuisine, which is also popular in other post-Soviet countries and around the world.

Russian.title: Medovik
Russian.description: Medovik is a layer cake popular in countries of the former Soviet Union. The identifying ingredients are honey and smetana (sour cream) or condensed milk.

Russian.title: Napolion
Russian.description: Napoleon cake is a perfectly moist and deliciously creamy dessert made of crunchy puff pastry and silky pastry cream

Russian.title: Sharlotka
Russian.description: Sharlotka is a classic Russian apple cake. In some parts of the world, it’s known as the French Apple cake.

Russian.title: Kyiv cake
Russian.description: Kyiv cake is a dessert cake produced in Kyiv, Ukraine since December 6, 1956 by the Karl Marx Confectionery Factory which is now a subsidiary of the Roshen corporation.

Russian.title: Bird milk
Russian.description: Bird's milk is a Central European confectionery originating in Poland. It is a small, chocolate-covered bar with a soft marshmallow-like interior.

Russian.title: Plov
Russian.description: Pilaf or pilau is a rice dish, or in some regions, a wheat dish, whose recipe usually involves cooking in stock or broth.

Russian.title: Dried Fish
Russian.description: Fresh fish rapidly deteriorates unless some way can be found to preserve it.

Russian.title: Salted and marinated Fish
Russian.description: Salted fish, such as kippered herring or dried and salted cod, is fish cured with dry salt and thus preserved for later eating

Jewish.title: Gefilte fish
Jewish.description: A dish made from a poached mixture of ground deboned fish, such as carp, whitefish, or pike

Jewish.title: Chopped liver
Jewish.description: A spread popular in Jewish cuisine made by chopping or grinding liver

Jewish.title: P'tcha
Jewish.description: A traditional Jewish dish made from jellied calves' feet

Jewish.title: Chraime
Jewish.description: A spicy fish stew dish in Jewish cuisine

Jewish.title: Chrain
Jewish.description: A type of horseradish paste used in Jewish cuisine

Jewish.title: Chicken soup
Jewish.description: A soup made from chicken, simmered in water, usually with various other ingredients

Jewish.title: Knedalach
Jewish.description: Dumplings often served in chicken soup

Jewish.title: Matzah brei
Jewish.description: A dish of Ashkenazi Jewish origin made from matzah fried with eggs

Jewish.title: Lox
Jewish.description: Lox is a fillet of brined salmon, which may be smoked.

Jewish.title: Latke
Jewish.description: A type of potato pancake or fritter in Ashkenazi Jewish cuisine that is traditionally prepared to celebrate Hanukkah

Jewish.title: Forshmak
Jewish.description: It's probably the most authentically Jewish herring recipe. The word itself is Yiddish for “pre-taste”–that is, an appetizer, meant to set your taste buds going

Georgian.title: Khinkali
Georgian.description: A Georgian dumpling filled with spiced meat

Georgian.title: Satsivi
Georgian.description: A thick paste made from walnuts and served cold

Georgian.title: Chakhokhbili
Georgian.description: A traditional Georgian dish made from stewed chicken

Georgian.title: Badrijani Nigvzit
Georgian.description: Eggplant rolls filled with a walnut paste

Georgian.title: Lobio
Georgian.description: A Georgian dish made with kidney beans

Georgian.title: Kharcho
Georgian.description: A spicy soup made with beef, rice, and walnuts

Georgian.title: Ajapsandali
Georgian.description: A vegetarian dish made from eggplants, potatoes, and tomatoes
